stanford.spl

Class GTextArea

  • java.lang.Object
    • acm.graphics.GObject
      • stanford.spl.GInteractor
        • stanford.spl.GTextArea
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GResizable, GScalable, Serializable, Cloneable

    public class GTextArea
extends GInteractor
    The GTextArea class is a graphical object whose appearance consists of a rectangular area that can display text.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_FONT

        public static final Font DEFAULT_FONT
        The default font used to display text. You can change the font by invoking the setFont method.

        public static final Color DEFAULT_BG_COLOR

        Creates a new GTextArea object with its anchor point at the specified position.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of this GTextArea in pixels
        height - The height of this GTextArea in pixels

      • setFont

        public void setFont(Font font)
        Changes the font used in the GTextArea.
        Overrides:
        setFont in class GInteractor
        Parameters:
        font - A Font object indicating the new font

      • setFont

        public void setFont(String str)
        Changes the font used to display the GTextArea as specified by the string str, which is interpreted in the style of Font.decode. The usual format of the font string is 
            family-style-size
        where both style and size are optional. If any of these parts are specified as an asterisk, the existing value is retained.
        Overrides:
        setFont in class GInteractor
        Parameters:
        str - A String specifying the new font

      • getFont

        public Font getFont()
        Returns the font used by this GTextArea.
        Overrides:
        getFont in class GInteractor
        Returns:
        The font in use by this object

      • setText

        public void setText(String str)
        Changes the text displayed by this GTextArea object.
        Parameters:
        str - The new string to display

      • getText

        public String getText()
        Returns the text displayed by this object, encoded in Base64.
        Returns:
        The text displayed by this object

      • setEditable

        public void setEditable(boolean flag)
        Sets whether this text area is editable.
        Parameters:
        flag - true for editable

      • contains

        public boolean contains(double x,
                        double y)
        Checks to see whether a point is inside the object.
        Overrides:
        contains in class GObject
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the point being tested
        y - The y-coordinate of the point being tested
        Returns:
        true if the point (x, y) is inside the object, and false otherwise
